roleset.name: be a bother

example.name: all args
example.text: Among other reasons, high fees *trace* regulators imposed *trace* on certain transfers of thrift deposits to commercial banks ``substantially altered the economics of the transaction for both parties,'' Poughkeepsie said.
example.arg: on certain transfers of thrift deposits to commercial banks

example.name: no 'benefactive'
example.text: Market Order: This is probably the most widely used order -- and -- the one most open to abuse by unscrupulous floor brokers, since it -- imposes no price restrictions.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: The new sanctions proposed by the United States and Russia would impose an arms embargo on the Taliban .
example.arg: The new sanctions proposed by the United States and Russia

roleset.note: IMPOSE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'impose' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. No comparison. (from impose.01-v predicate notes)
IMPOSITION-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from imposition.01-n)
